messages.content: What does the baseball event code '7/F7LD' mean?
'7/F7LD' means a fly ball to left field, with the batter being put out as a result of a line drive that is caught.
Explain 'D8/L89XD+'.
'D8/L89XD+' signifies a double to centerfield, where the play is considered a line drive and hit to a particular spot in the outfield.
What does '13/G1S' signify?
'13/G1S' means a ground ball to the pitcher which resulted in a single for the batter.
Explain 'K' in baseball event code.
'K' indicates a strikeout.
What does 'W' mean as a baseball event code?
'W' signifies a walk.
What is the meaning of 'HR/F78XD.1-H'?
'HR/F78XD.1-H' denotes a home run that was a fly ball to center-right field, including a line drive type out in the outfield, with a runner on first scoring.
Explain 'E6/TH/G6+.B-1'.
'E6/TH/G6+.B-1' represents an error by the shortstop on the throw, where a runner advanced to first.
What does '8/L8D' mean?
'8/L8D' signifies a line drive to center field that is a double.
Explain '8/F8'.
'8/F8' means the batter is out on a fly ball to center field.
What is 'S9/L9'?
'S9/L9' represents a single, hit to right field via a line drive.
Explain 'PO2(14)'
'PO2(14)' means the runner was picked off (PO) of second base, with the pitcher (1) and the second baseman (4) combining for the out.
What does 'PO1(13)' mean?
'PO1(13)' signifies the runner was picked off (PO) of first base, with the pitcher (1) and the third baseman (3) combining for the out.
Explain 'PO3(25)'.
'PO3(25)' means the runner was picked off (PO) of third base, with the pitcher (2) and the catcher (5) combining for the out.
What is the meaning of 'PO1(36)'?
'PO1(36)' signifies the runner was picked off (PO) of first base, with the pitcher (3) and the shortstop (6) combining for the out.
What does 'PO1(46)' mean?
'PO1(46)' means the runner was picked off (PO) of first base, with the pitcher (4) and the left fielder (6) combining for the out.
Explain 'PO1(78)'.
'PO1(78)' signifies the runner was picked off (PO) of first base, with the pitcher (7) and the right fielder (8) combining for the out.
What is 'PO1(89)'?
'PO1(89)' represents the runner was picked off (PO) of first base, with the pitcher (8) and the center fielder (9) combining for the out.
Explain 'PO1(9)'.
'PO1(9)' means the runner was picked off (PO) of first base, with the pitcher (9) and the right fielder (9) combining
